repnme.cdata!: Romania - Second Private Sector Adjustment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory.  1) Following are some of the major lessons
            learned. Adjustment lending is successful when Government
            commitment is strong. 2) The synergy between the IMF and WB
            in supporting the structural agenda is key for ensuring the
            sustainability of the reforms. 3) Clear regional integration
            goals, such as EU accession, provide strong incentive for
            reform. 4) A key factor in the success of the PSAL II was
            the availability of substantial technical assistance to
            carry out the reforms and privatizations. 5) Use flexibility
            to adjust strategies based on  market conditions. 6) Despite
            the broad scope of the project, the loan included a detailed
            policy matrix that was easily monitored. This specificity
            contributed to the success of implementation, as it set
            clear goals for the Government. 7) Constant field presence
            proved to be an essential element of success given the depth
            and complexity of such an ambitious reform program.

6039994.trustfund:
TF025553-PHRD-ROMANIA PSAL II PROJECT,TF030313-CANADIAN CTF FOR CENTRAL AND
            EASTERN EUROPE FY03 - ECA GENERAL,TF030428-CANADIAN CTF FOR CENTRAL AND
            EASTERN EUROPE FY04 - ECA GENERAL,TF030465-IRISH CTF FY04 - EASTERN EUROPE,TF039836-ROMANIA - PSAL II,TF040187-ROMANIA AND UKRAINE BANKING SYSTEM,TF040346-ROMANIA - PREPARATION AND
            APPRAISAL OF 2ND PRIVATE SECTOR ADJUSTMENT LO,TF040809-ROMANIA: PRIVATE SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN II,TF040899-ROMANIA: PSAL II

repnme.cdata!:
Romania - Second Private Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project : Release of Second Tranche - Full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Private Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project was designed to build on, and complement the
            financial, and enterprise sector reforms already undertaken
            by the Government, supported by the Bank and the first
            Private Sector Adjustment Loan Project. Recent economic
            developments show Romania is pursuing a broad reform agenda,
            including economic, institutional and governance reforms,
            anchored in the process of EU accession. However, there has
            been a marked deterioration of the current account deficit
            to in 2003, fuelled in part by the expansion of bank credit
            to the private sector. Foreign direct investment (FDI)
            increased slightly in 2003, while fiscal deficit is
            relatively manageable, although quasi fiscal deficits remain
            high. Overall, the Bank considers the macroeconomic
            situation, and policy framework in Romania satisfactory, and
            conditions for second tranche release have been met, or
            substantially met, in areas related to the financial sector,
            energy sector, privatization and social protection.
            Conditions substantially met demonstrate that a) the monthly
            rate of collection for payments to Termoelectrica reached
            one hundred percent of the total electricity billings for
            each month commencing October 1, 2001, and, b) the
            cumulative monthly rate of collection for payments to
            Termoelectrica for district heating supplies reached at
            least ninety-seven and a half percent of the total billings
            for the period commencing January 1, 2002. In view of the
            overall performance and progress with the implementation of
            the program supported by the Loan, and in compliance with
            specific release conditions of the Loan Agreement, the
            second tranche is available for release to the Borrower.

5086399.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Romania - Second Private Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Private Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project will build on, and complement the financial,
            and enterprise sector reforms already underway. The project
            will pursue five key development objectives: 1) exit of
            public banks from government ownership, through
            privatization, and other options, accompanied by measures to
            strengthen the overall environment for private sector
            banking, and financial sector modernization; 2) divestiture
            of the largest public sector industrial, and commercial
            loss-makers from the government portfolio, accompanied by
            further measures to complete privatization of pools of
            enterprises, and joint ventures, ensuring transparency; 3)
            reform of the energy sector, introducing modern management
            principles, and sound regulation to ensure utility companies
            from cross-subsidization and soft credit, potentially
            forestalling enterprise restructuring. Reforms will be
            supported by legal and regulatory frameworks for private
            sector participation, increasing prices to cost recovery
            levels, ensuring consistency in tariff structures, and
            increasing collections for sustainable operations,
            reinvestment, and quality service delivery; 4) strengthening
            of the business environment, by removing administrative
            barriers that hamper investment and trade, removing special
            funds for fiscal consolidation, and, strengthening
            bankruptcy practice standards for a competitive private
            sector -oriented economy; and, 5) provision of social
            protection systems, and safety nets, in particular for
            workers affected by restructuring, and privatization.

Romania - Second Private Sector Adjustment
